Row.Text: The [B]Mississippians [/B] were a contemporary of the [B]Shawnee's [/B] ancestors.
[B]Tecumseh[/B] lived in lands later occupied by [B]America[/B].
[B]Tecumseh[/B] was an indigenous person in the Americas.
The [B]Shawnee [/B] are from the same continent as [B]Mexico[/b].
The [B]Shawnee [/B] are from the same continent as [B]Mexico[/b].
[B]Hides[/B] were an important commodity to the [B]Shawnee[/B].

The forest trappers enter the city at dawn, burdened by the tanned and stretched hides they intend for the market. They are met, sometimes even outside the gates, by merchants eager for trade - hides have become vital to the {1_Civilization_Adj} economy... as have their procurers.
You have unlocked Shawnee by improving 3 Hides Resources.
The [B]Shawnee [/B] were friends with many smaller nations.

Power in {1_Civilization_Adj} lands emerges not only from the palace, but from the network of diplomatic alliances that converge there. The teachings of the prophet Tenskwatawa have begun to circulate among some that move between the city-states and {1_Civilization_Adj} cities; a lesson of unity in the face of change.
You have unlocked Shawnee by becoming the Suzerain of 2 City-States.
